instructions: Open iMovie . Tap Create Project , then select Movie . In the Camera Roll, tap the video you want to edit to add a blue check mark. Tap Create Movie . Tap Edit . Place two fingers on the clip (at the top of the screen) and make a rotating motion. An icon appears, and the clip moves when you lift your fingers. Rotate 90 degrees at a time, either clockwise or counterclockwise. Tap Done to save the changes. To save the updated video, tap Share , tap Save Video , then choose an export size. The video will process and move to your Library (in your Photos app).

Open iMovie, then click Create New . Click Movie . Select Import Media , then find the movie you want to modify and click OK . In the Media pane, click the clip. In the Preview window, click the Crop button. Click either Rotate Clockwise or Rotate Counterclockwise as many times as desired. Each click moves the clip 90 degrees. Rotating may create bars at the top and bottom of your video. Click Crop to access the Crop tool . Drag the handles to eliminate the bars, then click the blue check mark to make the changes. To save the updated video, click Share , click File , then follow the prompts to name the file and choose a location.
